testCases.explanation: The largest island has area 6, found in the bottom-right region.
Single cell grid with one land cell has area 1.
All four cells are land and connected, forming one island of area 4.
Two diagonal land cells are not connected (only 4-directional adjacency), each island has area 1.

description:
You are given an m x n binary matrix `grid`. An island is a group of 1's (representing land) connected 4-directionally (horizontal or vertical). You may assume all four edges of the grid are surrounded by water.

Return the maximum area of an island in `grid`. If there is no island, return 0.

See the full problem on [LeetCode 695](https://leetcode.com/problems/max-area-of-island/).
